metadata.md:title: Anatomy & Physiology
metadata.md:abstract:
Human Anatomy and Physiology is designed for the two-semester anatomy and physiology course taken by life science and allied health students. The textbook follows the scope and sequence of most Human Anatomy and Physiology courses, and its coverage and organization were informed by hundreds of instructors who teach the course. Instructors can customize the book, adapting it to the approach that works best in their classroom.
The artwork for this textbook is aimed focusing student learning through a powerful blend of traditional depictions and instructional innovations. Color is used sparingly, to emphasize the most important aspects of any given illustration. Significant use of micrographs from the University of Michigan complement the illustrations, and provide the students with a meaningful alternate depiction of each concept. Finally, enrichment elements provide relevance and deeper context for students, particularly in the areas of health, disease, and information relevant to their intended careers.

col:subcollection.md:title: An Introduction to the Human Body

Elements and Atoms: The Building Blocks of Matter
Inorganic Compounds Essential to Human Functioning
Organic Compounds Essential to Human Functioning

Diseases, Disorders, and Injuries of the Integumentary System

col:module.md:title: The Functions of the Skeletal System
Exercise, Nutrition, Hormones, and Bone Tissue

Embryonic Development of the Axial Skeleton
Nervous System Control of Muscle Tension
Development and Regeneration of Muscle Tissue
Interactions of Skeletal Muscles, Their Fascicle Arrangement, and Their Lever Systems
Axial Muscles of the Head, Neck, and Back
Axial Muscles of the Abdominal Wall and Thorax
Muscles of the Pectoral Girdle and Upper Limbs
Appendicular Muscles of the Pelvic Girdle and Lower Limbs

col:subcollection.md:title: The Nervous System and Nervous Tissue

col:module.md:title: Basic Structure and Function of the Nervous System
Circulation and the Central Nervous System
Divisions of the Autonomic Nervous System
Drugs that Affect the Autonomic System
An Overview of the Endocrine System

col:subcollection.md:title: The Cardiovascular System: Blood Vessels and Circulation

col:module.md:title: Structure and Function of Blood Vessels

The Adaptive Immune Response: T lymphocytes and Their Functional Types

col:subcollection.md:title: Unit 5: Energy, Maintenance, and Environmental Exchange

col:module.md:title: Organs and Structures of the Respiratory System

col:subcollection.md:title: Unit 6: Human Development and the Continuity of Life

col:module.md:title: Anatomy and Physiology of the Male Reproductive System
